intro: Lobostemon cephaloides, commonly known as the Cape bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its distinctive bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late summer. Lobostemon cephaloides is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
